Name: Djalaj
Title: This can’t be from Bikaner
Review: Cash counter is always without a change. They force you to pay by UPI or by card. The person handling the counter needs to undergo a training  on being humble and polite to customers.

Name: Bhanu Pratap Singh
Title: Best Deals
Review: I visit the Lajpat Nagar central market for the first time. I find it a little rush area. I might get stuck in the market if I do not have a PARK+ app with me for parking. But it is a great place to buy quality products at the best price. If you are looking for the same, it is a perfect place for you.

Name: run007
Title: Best shopping
Review: Best shopping in Delhi with affordable rates.Only best deal to take from , make sure you bargain until you get a good deal.

Name: ByeJeanette
Title: Worth a visit
Review: I liked This market but found as a tourist most sellers were not interested in showing me any merchandise Even when i asked for it. The prices were a bit higher than toget Places we have been to in India.

Name: rajesh u
Title: Pulse of the city
Review: Shopping areas tell us about the pulse of the cities and Lajpat Nagar is no exception. It's a must for any visitor. For the Indian tourist it's a great bargain, a place from where you carry back goods. You also carry back the idea about what commerce can do! For the visitor from the West it's more interesting. A melting hub of humanity, in all shapes and attire, bumping into each other, striking out the perfect deal. The salesmen selling shirts selling for less than a dollar to shops stocking the most expensive ones. All in harmony. The small streets are a taken for granted by the locals but are a tourist's delight with the sheer variety of wares, the colorful arrangements and the beautifully lit up atmosphere.Must spend an hour. Enjoy the street food. Walk and soak in the atmosphere. It's a must.

Name: SmithaCherian
Title: The friendly market
Review: We thoroughly enjoyed being in this market. We would visit again and shop more. Though it’s a big expensive than Sarojini Nagar I liked this market. The food is to die for

Name: Wanderer23635804919
Title: rows n rows of shops
Review: Great range of all sorts of indian wear,accesories, kurtas,suits,shoes.Be mindful to safe keep your belongings.Getting an uber or ola in the evenings is almost impossible. get a rickshaw to move you 1 or 2 km away then get your transport.

Name: NamitaPattnaik
Title: Lots of branded / non-branded shop for mid range shopping
Review: Perfect for mid-range shoppers. At lajpath nagar market you can find good western wear and mid-range ethnic wear.

Name: chikpick
Title: A middle class bazaar....
Review: Closed on mondays, this market has everything needed for a wedding shopping. though not many branded showrooms r there but common brands like VIP, BIBA, MEENABAZAAR, Madame, U.S.Polo etc r there. Apart from this lot of local shops selling readymades, kurtas, accessories r there. also for the shoppers there are tasty chaat kiosks available. For a perfect shopping feel this place is a must to visit. with local vendors bargaining can be done. There is something for everyone in their budget.

Name: AVNI
Title: Too crowded
Review: If you are looking for apparel to wear on a wedding or parties, this is the place. It has lots of shops of sarees, lehengas and other dresses. Also, restaurants and stalls serving good street food.

Name: Aman Sachdeva
Title: Aman Groom Studio
Review: I am a world traveller and tried tailoring at various place across the world. But I can surely say that this is one of the most pleasing experience. I just had 24 hrs to get the suit tailored, and I am glad I was given a great tailoring experience and was called well before time and delivered on time. I would surely recommend this place for people travelling to Delhi. They have great collection of fabrics, great tailoring unit and most importantly the commitment to deliver on time.

Name: ashishdeora123
Title: nice
Review: A residential and commercial point near South Delhi district is Lajpat Nagar which was named in honour of Lala Lajpat Rai who was known to Indians as the Lion of Punjab Central market is the most visited spot in Lajpat Nagar where people come to buy fabrics, shoes, ornaments, food items etc

Name: kamal_innovaa
Title: Good for shopping
Review: Market has very big and with well direction.They small to big show rooms. Also they have street vendors where you can buy many things.

Name: Ishita Sarkar
Title: Central market
Review: This is one of the mostb famous markets in New Delhi. Full of variety, reasonable and having so many street food stalls.

Name: Sarina14
Title: If you love shopping and can bargain, this is a market to visit in Delhi
Review: Lajpat Nagar Central Market has its share of loyal shoppers like me who despite all the problems like impossible parking, the crowds, the uncleanliness still love the market for its amazing bargains.  I have been going to Lajpat Nagar market for many years. Earlier I would drive but now I prefer to take the metro or an auto.  One can find wonderful clothes that are trendy and cheap,  the tastiest chaat,  and not to forget talented mehndi artists who are busy applying mehndi sitting on the footpaths.   One can find household wares, jewelery, groceries, sweets, savories,shoes, bags... gosh the list is endless.  If you are good at bargaining, you will do well here. Street vendors dot the entire market.

Name: parul k
Title: Nice
Review: It's like sarojini nagar market. You have to be good in bargaining. Lots of big brands are also there.

Name: Rahul B
Title: Very bad
Review: I don’t think this place currently deserves a star. Dingy place, unclean urinals, untrained staff with poor food quality is the hallmark of this place. No points in guessing that all three of us landed up with food poisoning! I have retained a copy of the bill and will bring the issue at the right forum. Guys please be wary of this place. Even roadside Chinjabi joints serve better food!

Name: stardust
Title: I love the market! Affordable beautiful clothing and local street foods
Review: I mostly went to Lajpat Nagar central market for two things: shopping (especially traditional Indian clothes), and eat the famous chat right at the entrance of the market during the evening hours. The clothes are decent and cheap. Bargaining skills can come handy. While there are clothes on deal on the street market, there are also permanent shops that have clothes of higher quality. They are of course a bit more expensive.  There is also one amazing stationary in lajpat nagar if you are into art and stationary. Place is crowded with locals, and for me that a positive aspect.

Name: Maha
Title: great goods
Review: I liked the quality of the producers. the cost was an average. even if there the goods in some shops were more expansive and no discount. If you want to buy somethings belong to India, you can find your goals in Lajpat Nagar.

Name: Raheel Ahmed
Title: Fun and Shopping spree
Review: It's a wonderful place to shop. But you'll have to be careful in terms of bargaining. Long streets of applying Mehandi in Girl's hand. Crazzy shopping centre, along with Awesome place for snacks and food. Enjoy it...

Name: Indian Hotel Center
Title: Good place for shopping
Review: I visited this market today, the whole market was full of colours of indipendance day, as i was there on 14 August. Lots of variety of cloths etc. and I saw lots of big showrooms, prices are not fixed, you should bargain.

Name: Morgan W
Title: Travel with a Local
Review: I would not advise a tourist to visit the bazaar alone because it is a huge rabbit warren of twisted streets that do start to look alike. Make a list before hand, so you don't miss out on anything you were planning on buying. Prices are usually good, but some vendors expect bargaining and others do not. The brick and mortar stores have fixed prices.Sturdy walking shoes are recommended, too.

Name: Robin
Title: Shopaholic Paradise
Review: Lajpat Nagar is a famous shopping area, where you can buy items related to accessories, footwear, clothes, or bags

Name: rohitagarwal55
Title: A Typical Indian Shopping Market
Review: A typical Indian market that you need for purchasing. It has everything, small road side shops, narrow lanes, lots of bargaining, eating joints (roadside and big brands like KFC, Mcdonald, Burger King, Bikanerwala and lots more), almost all branded showrooms from Raymond, Woodland, Van Husen to whatever you can think of in general. You need good stamina if want to enjoy your shopping and explore different shops. You can also enjoy variety of foods like North Indian, Chinese, South Indian, street food, chaats, samosa, ram laddoos etc. of your taste.

Name: Vikram Sharma
Title: Market
Review: In this market you will be get purchase everything you want on the price you want to spend. Ladies wear purchase on priority in this market.

Name: Vikram Aditya Sukhija
Title: Typical Indian market
Review: The market is majorly concentrated with clothing items and accessories. It is a good choice for shopping. It has many eateries if you wanna grab a bite and take a break from shopping. Would suggest to avoid going at noon when it's too hot.

Name: vidushi jain
Title: Shopping
Review: Lajpat Nagar is centered on the sprawling Central Market, a colorful maze of narrow lanes with stalls and shops selling vivid saris, embroidered fabrics, kitchenware and herbal cosmetics. There are also plenty of henna tattooists and street food stands offering samosas, momo dumplings and fried aloo tikki patties. No-frills family-run restaurants serving Indian and Chinese food sit next to Western fast-food spots.

Name: rykumar
Title: Best restaurant ever
Review: My family has been visiting this restaurant for the last 20 years... but its taste and service still remains immaculate... its a beautiful cosy restaurant with a twist of chinese vibes... must visit if you are in lajpat nagar

Name: SandeepSaha1967
Title: South Delhi's answer to Delhi-6?
Review: It's a market where you get everything from a needle to a house. The only catch is that for a beginner or an infrequent visitor, you don't know where to go for what. But that's where the charm perhaps lies as you navigate the many lanes and talk to the push-cart vendors for directions.In chaos and disordiness, it vies with the famed Chandni Chowk and even has its legendary chaat and snack joints of its own. On the options, the price range, the chances of getting your price, the variety of things on offer, one could not ask for more.The administration has made several hesitant attempts to bring order, but the theory of entropy finally always prevails - everything will ultimately reach its higher order of randomness.

Name: Atm530
Title: Two extremes of the Market
Review: This market was good to experience people watching but not for my needs for things were either too expensive or too junky. The merchants were not as helpful as other parts of India.  I bought at one shop and found things 4 times cheaper in other markets. The chain stores on the other hand in LN Market were helpful and midrange in prices with fairly good quality products.

Name: journeywithfoodie
Title: Afghani cuisine - Barg Restaurant
Review: The restaurant is owned by one of my friend and he invited us to relish on Afghani delicacies and to my surprise I was amazed by THE DISHES..1. Afghani soup - It was yumm. I couldn't stop myself from having this full bowl of soup.2. Afghani naan is littlw hard but it was fine.3. Alfam - chicken preparation that made me happy while binging on.4. Mutton tikka - It was juicy and its the first time that O had such juicy mutton tikka.5. Tandoori chicken - loved it a lot it was tender and smoky6. Kebab (mutton) - it was good too7. Uzbeki - its little sweet and full of dry fruits - Rice preparation.8. Plain rice - prepared juat like what you have at your home.9. Bhindi - Veggy - it was a little different preparation style and it was fine.10. Rajma - Veggy - it was fine too.11. Spinach - Veggy - I liked it...12. Mantu - afghani momos - little different and not that spicy.13. Afghani ice cream - you should definitely try it out. It was out of the box for me and couldnt control myself frkm having more..What my perception was that Afghani dishes were not apicy and bland in taste. Though they were not that spicy but the dishes were not at all bland. Some were but not all.Staffs - very cordial and courteous and they have a smile on their face which makes you smile too...Its a small but cosy and comfortable restaurant in Lajpat nagar.Would definitely recommend it to all...

Name: Amolak Rattan K
Title: A very popular and busy market
Review: This is one of the most visited markets of Delhi for the last over five decades. You name a requirement, you will get multiple choices of quality and reasonable price. Clothes, house artifacts, paintings groceries, eating joints and Latest Electronic goods are the main attractions. A must visit place.Amolak Rattan Kohli Former Governor of Mizoram

Name: Nins
Title: Whats different - Henna artists!!!
Review: Lajpat Nagar is a popular shopping area where you can get whatever you desire - accessories, clothes(saris and salwar kameezes for women to kurtas and kurtis for both men and women- The Lucknowi embroider), footwear, bags, etc. You will also find many henna artist here- mind boggling designs. Also here are huge glittering showrooms as well as roadside stalls. Bargain is a must everywhere!!!

Name: shanu0402
Title: I’m enjoying my office at Lajpat Nagar area
Review: Hi I worked as branch head for one of the large pvt bank in India .. and my branch is at Lajpat Nagar. For last 4 years I’m coming going there daily.. and man , this is the heart of DELHI .. Lajpat Nagar is the food capital of DELHI and the market here offers great fashion stores with convenience and budget to all kinds of customers..It is one of the top place to visit at Delhi . Some of the must visit place at Lajpat Nagar:1. Chole Kulche at central market park.2. Jewelleries shops like Dhirsons/ Radha Krishna 3. Ram Laddoo 4. Kachori and pakori shops etc etc

Name: alneebari
Title: Street market
Review: It's a faimos street market in Delhi you can find all shop is good praise from sari and corta and for  children

Name: Sundara Rajan N
Title: Wedding Shopping
Review: This is a typical Delhi Market for all type of shopping. We had our daughter's Wedding Dress purchase from here. Nice place to shop out with family. Good eating joints too around there. Parking is not an issue, but a bit walking required.

Name: Selina B
Title: Fantastic market
Review: This a great market, much better than Chandi Chowk. We started at the car park off the main road and walked down the road where there were lots of market stalls outside the market, on the road side, there were also some good shops which had some designer wear for cheap - I believe these to be fakes but can not confirm.You then enter the main market and yes it is busy busy but no where near as busy as Chandi Chowk. You can get some great bargains here, you can haggle and most are very friendly and helpful.I got all my gifts for friends and family here.

Name: ashwanikumar
Title: Finger licking is good
Review: Place is nice and no one doubt on taste of KFC.. It's located in Central market due to which it's very crowded.. Service is little slow but staffs are quite helpful.. There are other eating points also but KFC has its own craze

Name: Smitpoo
Title: Must Visit fr Shopholic!!
Review: Best way to visit this place is to through is Metro.Its hardly 5 to 10 Minutes to reach main market.I visited this place to buy stationary ,art and craft stuffs.Place is got lot of options in all segment.During weekend place is crowded ,weekday is  always a better option.You can bargain here !!

Name: Manas R
Title: Shopping choices
Review: It is a pleasure while shopping here with family. Lots of choices, great food and location add advantages to this place as shopping destination.

Name: GauravDel
Title: Complete Shopping Destination !!!
Review: This market doesn't need any introduction and has been the first choice for every shopaholic in and around Delhi. You can find every kind of stuff in this busy and crowded market but the best part is the variety. Reaching there can be a bit difficult during festive seasons as parking is a complete mess. Best option is to walk from Lajpat Nagar metro station as it will hardly take 10-15 mins.

Name: Gurpreet Singh
Title: Wide range of shopping
Review: Central Market Lajpat Nagar has got a wide range & variety for shopping. From cotton stuff (females) to Sherwanis, curtains, belts, shoes etc its got everything. You can do bargain street shopping to brands like Meena Bazaar & Westside. Eat street food or binge at Mcdonalds, Pizza Hut etc. Market is mostly crowded on weekends, Closed on mondays. Parking may take few mins but you will get 1. If you wanna avoid parking hassle, use metro.Very well connected by Pink & Voilet metro line.

Name: Jose Sabate Sab... S
Title: Many people
Review: We went to this market as a friend oficina US suggest us And found many stuffs to buy but t'he market is very busy And quite dirty...other wise its a good place for shopping...

Name: rahulkD6102RP
Title: Good market for both cheap as well as brand
Review: lots of options are available , cheap options and u will find almost all good brands , near to metro station overall decnt experience for shopping

Name: Vaibhav S
Title: Desi Shopping Hub in the Heart of Delhi ....
Review: I've been to this place several times with my family, recently I was there on the last weekend, although this was not in the actual plan and we were to visit only National Science Centre in Delhi but as we were done well in time, my wife just initiated the thought of going there.We visited the place and first of all had a wonderful lunch out there just across the road in front of the market ...cann't remember the name but it was just a street food counter and we enjoyed the vada pav and tawa pulav ( this was amazing ). Afterwards, we entered the market which was like vally of dreams for my wife, huge number of shops with ladies apparels and footwears and that too with a heavy scope of negotiations.So, if you are a shopping freak you must visit this place in Delhi. And believe me you won't be left out hungry as there are so many street food options available.The only concern is the parking, if you are lucky you will get it otherwise they do have street side parking also available, but I feel the best way is to reach over there is by using public conveyance in order to have a tension free experience. But just load your pockets if you are going with your wives :)

Name: PushExplore
Title: Nice but super crowded
Review: This is quite a popular market place in South Delhi. It has all kinds of fashion wear (Indian and western) local designers. Parking here is a nightmare, but once you are here, you will enjoy the shopping for sure. Bargain hard

Name: Businesstripinsider
Title: Business
Review: Congestive, but hot place for shopping every thing a to z at bargain. Wide range of general fancy stores. But it's a place with massive illegal construction and extensions with absolute fire hazard

Name: Sanjit M
Title: Nice place for family shopping
Review: Lajpat nagar central market is a nice place for family shopping for all types of clothes, shoes, etc. for ladies, gents & kids.

Name: Jeevika S
Title: Shoppung hub
Review: This market is better than sarojini nagar market in terms of crowd and clothes. Lajpat nagar market is famous for indian wear and eatery's. Other things are also available here. The proces depends on the quality and the brand.There is a movie theater as well.

Name: Paras P
Title: couple
Review: The lajpat nagar market is crowded this is perfect market for middle class people and almost all things were available here.It's a cool place for shopping especially for womenEasily accessible from metro station

Name: Akhil7147
Title: Family Shopping
Review: This is a very nice place for shopping of all types. Specially clothes for ladies, kids and gents. The place is cleaner then other delhi local markets. And is surely overly crowded as it is famous for its shopping. You also a cinema hall around named 3C’s where you can go and watch all the latest movies.

Name: GoodyFoodie31
Title: ONE THE BEST MARKET OF DELHI.
Review: LAJPAT NAGAR " CENTRAL MARKET " is one of the best MARKET in DELHI. If you are looking for shopping for apparels, Household things etc. You can try this market . You will never disappointed by this market . There are many branded showrooms for causal wear , ethnic wear , formal wear , shoes , if you are looking for some BRANDED STUFF . And the best thing you can shop here for apparels for only mini. 300/- for kurta , leggings etc only girly stuff , for daily wear with nice design and fabric .YOU will find evrything here , KURTA, FOOTWEARS, PLAZO, BEDSHEETS , BANGLES , KITCHEN UTENSILS , DOORMATS , MAKEUP STUFF etc. On both prices HIGHER AND LOWER . Both type of stuff are available here.IF YOU LOOKING FOR DRESSES FOR WEDDING YOU SHOULD VISIT THIS PLACE . NOTE:- THIS MARKET REMAIN CLOSE ON EVERY " MONDAY ".

Name: jogender t
Title: Nice place to complete your shopping needs
Review: Central market in Lajpat Nagar is a very good place to complete your shopping needs. It has a mixture cheap and expensive shops from where you can buy as per your needs. Also there are a variety of street foods that you can go for along with shopping.

Name: ShakilGani
Title: Awesome experience
Review: Lazpatnagar is the place to buy everything  in Delhi. Mandatory to go everybody, not only to shop but to take the flavour of incredible India😊

Name: Shubhgatsby
Title: family shopping
Review: you can get lots of things in affordable prices.specially made for girls there are some food spots also.

Name: thesizzlingdiary
Title: Great for wedding shopping
Review: Lajpat nagar has some really amazing shops for wedding shopping. You get beautiful jewellery here. In food, do try golden fiesta's Chinese platter.

Name: Kunal V
Title: A perfect place for Women Shopping
Review: Lajpat Nagar central market is a paradise for Women and a nightmare for their Husbands and Boyfriend's.It is a big market where local shopping can be done on widely and it's cheap. You gotta find the right stuff in the shop and prices will blow your mind. Don't forget to bargain.While the women are busy in their shopping the men can definitely watch a movie as there is a theatre just round the corner, or sit at KFC or visit CCD to pass their time.

Name: Rohit Aveek Mukherjee
Title: Amazing place for shopping
Review: It is a superb market for as shopping. Crowded in the evening and the shops sell the goods at reasonable price. Eating options are also available there. Easy way to get there. Just get down at lajpat Nagar metro station which us on violet line. Exit towards central market and walk for 10 minutes. You will get there

Name: Anna M
Title: Fabulous experience
Review: We wanted to experience the real Delhi and this is definitely it! We hopped in a rickshaw for a wild ride through the traffic to get there. Wildly colourful, noisy and smelly the market is a bit overwhelming but we went with the flow and had a marvellous time - so good we went twice and got some great bargains. If fixed price isn't advertised, you can negotiate prices and walk away if you don't like the deal. We resisted the temptation to eat the market food and managed to avoid upset tummies.

Name: Sunnytoes54
Title: An Electric Evening at the Market
Review: If you really want to experience the vibrancy of a local market, Lajpat Najar in the evening can’t be beaten. The brilliant lights turn the multi-coloured stalls in to pools of glittering gems... the  scents emanating from the countless street food vendors tempt you at every turn....and ....the vast array of goods for sale, from saris to lacquer bangles, tug constantly at your purse strings. An amazing symphony of street sounds accompany this ballet of the extreme and you just simply want to sit back, close your eyes and drift off... but you can’t... you don’t want to miss a second of this magical parade. If you find yourself in New Delhi, even if just for one night, spend an hour in the Lajpat Najar... you’ll be glad you did.

Name: purnima s
Title: Get what u need
Review: I stay right across, its a lavished version of local market,Markets have all regular n small labels from side where as on other end u can find big brands store.everything can be found here, High end wedding clothes, running materials to very regular wearables even home furnishings.Smashing heels to bathroom sleepers. Great street food Momo's to ram laddu, bakery products n fruit veggies.

Name: vibhadhamija
Title: Like other market in South Delhi
Review: Lots of window shoppers but i find this place very cool .You can find almost mid range to expensive buying items here .Parking is a big issue .Couples can find good stuff and have an option to view movie near PVR.Remains crowded on almost all days

Name: Rohit M
Title: You will go if you are a shopping buff
Review: Well as it goes by name .the place can be easily reached by any mode as its located on Ring road in Delhi .Its one heck of a crowded place during evenings especially  but you find almost everything here .Nice PVR cinema  as well in vicinity .This place i would recommend for shopping for ladies .There may be some known brands eating outlets but i cant recommend much as i rather prefer eating strret food but you can have most of fast food restros as well.PArking may be an issue so avoid taking your cars .

Name: khanwasim2017
Title: Shopping
Review: One of the finest and oldest place and all time best market for many customer and i think largest market in New Delhi where you can find each and every single things

Name: Kumar S
Title: Lajpat Nagar Central Market
Review: This market has some great options available for shopping and food. The nearest metro station is Lajpat Nagar.

Name: Shopkhoj
Title: Inside the anonymous Amar Colony furniture market in Delhi
Review: When my German  friend first told me about the furniture market in Amar Colony , I was actually dismissive about the very idea.  Amar Colony is a congested area in South Delhi. It is known for shops for  bridal wear dresses that are available at very reasonable prices .Who would go to Amar Colony for furniture , was my  thought . I was aware of the   MG Road furniture shops in  Gurgaon and the Kirti Nagar furniture market in West Delhi.But  Amar Colony in South Delhi ?Where on earth could that be .We soon  made enquiries and found our way . The approach to the market is quite difficult  , as  we found out when we were on our way there . This place is right in the heart of the Amar Colony residential area where there are  lots of small row houses . It is  a congested  area with very little parking space. Even the roads are narrow . Two wheelers, small cars, big cars, pedestrians and dogs are all moving along the same narrow road.   It is by accident that we found this  Delhi shopping market . There is no signage .  Dusty dressing tables and cupboards  were on the roadside. A single chair was being given the final polish at the  end of the road. There is a chaiwala ( tea stall vendor) dishing out innumerable cups of tea. I must say that we were not prepared for something this huge. It is  about  2000 square yards of open space . It is like a huge courtyard . The furniture shops are at the back end of the courtyard. There are unfinished furniture pieces by the hundreds all over the place. We make our way in through a narrow passage  where  loaders were busy ferrying furniture pieces in and out .  Cupboards, chest of drawers and  work desks are some of pieces  that were stocked here .They were all unfinished pieces , waiting to be polished and delivered.As we proceeded further , we  spotted the row of shops. They are not  really distinct furniture shops but rather  they are a single stretch of shops, each having a defined space ,approximately 25’ by 10 ‘, covered with  plastic sheets for   protection from sun& rain. They are temporary shelters, so there is no permanent roof over these shops.  There is a kind of walk way that would lead you to all the shops . The walkway is also stored with furniture.  There is a  common area behind the  shops for polishing and providing the finishing touches to the furniture pieces..  As we started walking and checking out the shops , we found several  antique  cupboards ,chest of drawers , stools, settees, center tables, bar stools, sofa sets, beds , dressing tables, coat hangers and treasure chests  . There were tin posters and brass idols , brass elephants , statues  ,lanterns, antique telephones and a myriad other items. What an amazing experience in the heart of Delhi.  Let me leave you with the following images ,,,

Name: lataw13
Title: A good market to roam in
Review: This market is pretty good for most things. It’s a good one to walk through as you’ll get a bit of everything in terms of shopping and food.

Name: Happy2Help247
Title: Essence of indian street shopping
Review: Lajpat Nagar Central market is located just beside the Lajpat Nagar metro station, making it easier to access.The market has a variety of shops for various price ranges. Every latest trendy cloth can be found here at the best prices! Moreover, there are a lot of food options for the tired shoppers to indulge in.

Name: Dimple S
Title: SHOPPING
Review: I always done my shopping from lajpat nagar as this is the best market in India ,where u get everything in very reasonable price. where u can bargain and even u get branded shops also.

Name: YatriForever
Title: Cash & carry.
Review: Visited this market after several years. Despite of demonitisation, its still a cash culture here. This is yet another legacy market of Delhi, around for six decades or more, catering to the middle class economy.There's bargaining, but is much less than what I've seen in the past. One should have a purpose to be here, you need to know your target items and shops, else time will fly. Best to go here in Uber or Ola or Metro, parking is a huge issue for self driven cars. We were here looking for curtains and other living room soft furnishing. There are ample options for decent food. However, I wouldn't rate this matket as a tourist attraction for first time visitors to Delhi, particularly for those who are from other metros and big towns of India.

Name: Peeyush P
Title: Shopper heaven
Review: A very crowded place, with very little space for pedestrians. Parking is also a nightmare at most times. However, if you brave all these little obstacles, the visit will be worth it, since this market is a delight for shoppers. Almost everything is available here, fitting every budget. While the pavements are full of excellent bargains, there are also large showrooms for expensive branded items with large range of choices. For those looking for apparel and footwear, especially of the budget variety, this market is one of the best places to visit. Even if you don't purchase anything, the browsing will be worthwhile. Also, you will not go hungry while shopping, since there is enough supply of yummy street food, from ram-laddoo to Chinese chaat and everything in between. If you crave branded fast food, just visit the food court of the 3Cs mall.

Name: Aakash Kumbhat
Title: Street Shopping
Review: Lajpat Nagar is basically crowded with Street Shop vendors spread all over the area along with all the brand outlets.Parking here is a huge mess however full facility is there including some security person standing at different points for help in parking.Along with it vsrious food outlets are also there as Burger King, McDonald's and the famous NATURAL ICE CREAM.

Name: Akiki111
Title: Easy-to-manage market
Review: I enjoy going to markets in whatever country I visit and India is no exception. I've been to a few in Delhi but I enjoy this one the most because while there are crowds it is not as overwhelming as others but still retains the energy, it has excellent road side good options particularly in the momo department, and most importantly the store managers are not aggressive. While there are bigger and more famous markets, come to this one if you want a local feel without the headache.

Name: Meghaa R
Title: Enjoy shopping
Review: I visited here in this June and found a large market with all kinds of varieties, in all things. A very important shopping hub where u can get all your things. I also got many online products here in reasonable prices, and its a must to visit here once if you go to Delhi, shopping lovers enjoy here and now good news is that this market has gone online

Name: Jiju Mathew P
Title: Shopping center
Review: One has to know where to go and what to buy and how to buy. otherwise the visit is a waste of time. There are various choice of items

Name: Kiruba S
Title: Monday holiday..
Review: Lajpat Nagar market is mainly known for its variety of clothing available at affordable price...Tips: 1. there are no fixed price shops... can bargain quite a lot especially if you are a local ( atleast pretend like one....)2. Mondays are off . But it's a boon for couple to manage children as there is plenty to shop and crowd seems far less these days.3. Nearest metro station is Lajpat Nagar walkable but road at work and lot of dogs!!!!4. Travelled there up and down by auto from green park... took Rs. 100 one way.

Name: Neerav_jain10
Title: Place to visit
Review: If you are a shopping lover then this is a place for u all to do shopping . Every thing is available in this market and at normal prices so must have a visit to this market.

Name: Harsh P
Title: My shopping spot
Review: Such a big market to buy cheap and good fashion stuff from streets. Very nice variety of fabrics at reasonable rates.

Name: Babawasim
Title: Shopping market
Review: One of the oldest largest and famous market in the heart of New Delhi anything you can buy no matter what you think but the best quality with affordable price I loved it

Name: pensiveplacid
Title: Amazing Afghani red meat food and market.
Review: There is an amazing Afghan restaurant with Halal red meat,clean and cheap no taxes!the market is full of good, nice and cheap ear rings,skirts and all you just need to walk around patiently.the Henna or Mhandi is soooo expensive there not suggested at all.Dresses and accessories are so good and don't forget to bargain of course!!

Name: Vinodarora
Title: Mr Vinod Arora
Review: Very good area  Good for street food Snacks are very nice and cheap Must enjoy cob on corn Parking is difficult but with a bit of help you can find Or just walk down from metro to central market and enjoy the rest of day

Name: Manoj A
Title: Best Non Branded Market for Girls
Review: Lajpat nagar central market is a crowded place with people coming from all over delhi  to find the locally manufactured as well as some branded clothing. Here you can find almost all types of clothes specially for girls. There is one showroom k-36 which sells export stuff and then there is a showroom C&M where girls can find varieties of clothes ranging from tops, kurti, one piece, shorts and ethnic wear. Its a one stop shop for everything for girls. For the locally manufactured clothing you have to walk a lot to find the stuff as per your needs.

Name: TriptiCharan
Title: Best open Market in South Delhi
Review: Lajpat Nagar Central Market is the best open Market in South Delhi. Dolma Aunty's Momos are a must try when you come here. Also do try the Grilled Chicken Sandwich and cold coffee of Golden Fiesta.

Name: Pulkita
Title: jack of all trades
Review: This place has everything.. cheap stuff, expensive stuff.. great street food, fast food joints.. footwear.. eateries, snacks to carry, juice bar, milkshake place, chaat place, ac fridge cover, people selling on the road, people begging on the roads, police surveillance, clothes hanging from shops, shoes stacked up in fancy shops, bedsheets, bedcovers, photo frames, gift items, fake flowers, nightsuits, sarees, fancy suits, dress material, crockery, movie hall, my god... you wish it and you'll find it. Look hard enough and you might even find a genie stuffed up in a bottle. amazing place. watch your wallet!

Name: neetar2017
Title: Mrs Neeta Rawal
Review: A great shopping centre. You get any and every thing here in just one market. From the most stylish high end stuff like clothing and diamonds to the most basic stuff like buttons, threads, junk Jwellery, name it and it's available here. The best of street food to the best of high end restaurants as well. Amazing market . In fact the best one in delhi

Name: Saleem Akhan
Title: Less choices for gents wear
Review: Am currently reviewing live from Lajpat Nagar as I can see that its very crowded and am here to purchase something for me and am not getting that thing , that I want to get as the choices are less comparing with ladies wear as my girlfriend had her hand full of bags but I have only one so market is highly recommended for ladies wear not for gents wear

Name: Shaikh Mehfooz
Title: Shpper's Delight
Review: A must visit place for shoppers, especially those who prefer street shopping. Ladies/Gents all kind of wearable items, footwears are available here. Winter clothes (jackets/sweats) are also available here at an affordable rate. While shopping you can also enjoy corns from street vendors. One of Delhi's best street market.

Name: Gurmeet S
Title: All that you want
Review: This is the best market in New Delhi. One can shop for anything and everything. It is all inclusive market for clothes, shoes bags, accessories jewelry and all that you can think of. It is very economical market catering to classes and masses.Very cost effective.The shops are very colorful loaded with all the latest merchandise.While shopping you can have quick bites like the Momos, roasted Corn cobs, coconut water, lemonade, gol gappas and other such eats. A visit to Lajpat Nagar will leave you mesmerized.

Name: RDKHAN
Title: Shopoholics----Must Visit
Review: It is a great market for shopping.This market has everything from clothes,footwear to household furnishings. One has to walk a lot to explore in this market.Even a day is less for Central Market.It provides a good variety in everything. It has showrooms & big shops at one hand and cheap/bargain road side vendors on the other. The jewellery & footwear bought from there are trendy are durable.One can find a nice collection of clothes,readymade or fabric of any kind there. Also, there is a dupatta matching centre and it has vibrant variety of the same. Also,good for buying household furnishings such as curtains & bedsheets etcThe henna walas also sit there roadside & some are really good.Also, it has plenty of restaurants and one can enjoy fingerlicking food there. The road side momos,cheese sandwich & banta are a real treat.

Name: somsontravel
Title: Shopping paradise
Review: There is nothing enough when it comes to shopping old markets of Delhi and one such gem is Lajpat Nagar central market. You get everything from bedsheets to designer party wear under same roof. Be ready for lot of bargaining. Carry water and snacks and wear walking shoes. Most of the shops accept only cash here.

Name: macy4469
Title: Lost Paradise
Review: I have been frequenting central market on every visit to India. I went looking for this place with a wrong location and wrong store. There were no shops and very disappointed. Upon checking I realized my mistake and went today April 25,2017, found all the hustle bustle of central market. This is a place that you must have in your calendar and in to do list.The side walk eateries is a real treat. Kachoris, Bread with cheese pakora and lassi...Ummm...don't miss them.Prices are reasonable and caters to all cultures and tastes.

Name: AweInclusive
Title: Shoppers: Put This On Your To-Do List Now
Review: This place is a sight for sore pockets. For realz.After being scammed at other locations when trying to find nice Indian attire, it felt so good to walk into an exciting location with a ton of variety and MARKED PRICES!This market has everything. Sis and I walked around for hours exploring clothes, jewelry, shoes, and accessories. The vendors also arrange tailoring! My sister bought a dress and the vendor walked us to the next street over where tailors were set up with sewing machines and the works. He took her measurements and when we came back 20 minutes later, her dress was finished! And the tailor didn’t charge, so I guess they have an agreement with the vendor.We also found a row of guys doing henna. We got our hands done in the most beautiful design and it lasted for a week. We made sure to do the henna near the market closing time so that we had finished our shopping and didn’t have to touch anything. There are tons of rickshaws, bikes, and taxis around, so you won’t have an issue finding a ride when it’s time to leave.In addition to shops, there are plenty of restaurants including chains like Burger King, and a few ATMs scattered about. We wished that we’d have found this location much earlier during our travels. It would have saved us literally hundreds of dollars on souvenirs!Although many of the shops have souvenir type items, there are some fancier clothing, jewelry, and décor shops as well. Basically everything for anyone! We loved it!

Name: suerohit
Title: Shopping
Review: Super deals on just about everything. Perfect place for bargains on clothes, fabric, shoes, housewares, linen and just about everything you may need.

Name: nomadic_heart7
Title: Great market for Shopaholics
Review: Plenty and plenty of shops . One of my fav places to shop with great deals and value for money. You get fashionable dresses, shoes and what not. There are many eating joints where you can enjoy street food. Love to shop in this place. Its highly recommendeed for Indian dresses .

Name: medha m
Title: Average !!
Review: Lajpat Nagar is not my first choice because the clothes here are not of good quality plus its more expensive as compared to janpath.

Name: aae191
Title: Great Market. Great Choice
Review: One of my favourite market in Delhi. Good quality and great price for any cloth, great variety and the vendors are not pushy or noisy.

Name: travelguru
Title: One of my favourite places to visit in Delhi
Review: I visited here 4 times. Twice during the day and twice at night as it was close to my hotel.Super market. Loads of shops and places for food. Very safe and friendly. No real hassle from shopkeepers trying to sell you anything you can just walk around browsing to your hearts content.Prices are good but better if you haggle. Got some real bargains here. My wife got lovely sandals for 150 rupees.I liked the atmosphere of the place.It is very close to metro station so easy to get to and there are plenty rickshaws from station to drop you off in the middle of the market

Name: Rosshan N
Title: "Superb Place"
Review: "Great market" "Great stuff" "Great prices" and the main thing "Great Vendors" as compared to other markets..Whether thy respect or not,least thy don't insult or abuse you like palika bazaar vendors..Happi shopping..!!

Name: Natalie S
Title: SHOPPING!
Review: We were looking for traditional Indian wardrobes (Sarees and Punjabis) for our friend’s wedding. There was a wide variety of prices and selections, you could find nice sarees for $60 USD. If you want an Indian market experience, this may be worth checking out. As with many markets, prices were always negotiable.

Name: Leanne H
Title: "Shopping Paradise"
Review: Great place to shop - fixed & bargaining.There are options for all types of fashions - so many well priced shoe stores!!!This a fantastic market to find the bargain priced item you have been looking for.Happy shopping!!
